National offshore powerboat racing: Grandstand view and standing ovation as racers return to Napier https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/national-offshore-powerboat-racing-grandstand-view-and-stand-ovation-as-racers-return-to-napier/MEOTDCBBSJACTFL3QQWOAJJRUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/national-offshore-powerboat-racing-grandstand-view-and-stand-ovation-as-racers-return-to-napier/MEOTDCBBSJACTFL3QQWOAJJRUI/ Doug LaingA perfect day on the water for the return of the Napier Offshore 100, last held in 2020. Sun, 17 Mar 2024 00:45:33 +0000 Colin Dunn and Darren Butterworth in Rainbow Haulage were second in the single one-hour race on the day but hold the upper hand going into the last race of the series, in which defending champion driver Mike Gerbic must win two half-hour races to retain the title. Photo / Paul Taylor

Mōrere hot pools reopening delayedhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/morere-hot-pools-reopening-delayed/OD7XDAT7INARRA7THUMFAOU45E/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/morere-hot-pools-reopening-delayed/OD7XDAT7INARRA7THUMFAOU45E/ Popular northern Hawke's Bay tourist attraction will stay closed for a few more months. Sat, 16 Mar 2024 22:21:45 +0000 Major remedial infrastructure works began last year at Mōrere Hot Springs, with DoC hopeful of reopening the facility in April or May this year. Supply chain delays impacting delivery of key septic system components mean they are now looking at an opening date closer to July.
